title: Demon
description: Recently divorced and mired in a meaningless existence, Clay drifts from his drab apartment to his equally lusterless job as an editor for a small Boston press--until the night Lucian finds him and everything changes with the simple words, "I'm going to tell you my story, and you're going to write it down and publish it."What begins as a mystery soon spirals into chaotic obsession as Clay struggles to piece together Lucian's dark tale of love, ambition, and grace-only to discover that the demon's story has become his own. And then only one thing learning how the story ends.Praise for  A Memoir"This is a stunning novel you'll remember not months, but years after you finish." -James L. Rubart, Christy Hall of Fame bestselling author of Rooms"This book is a masterpiece of fiction. It's hard to put down and impossible to forget." -Nancy Mehl, bestselling author of the Ryland & St. Clair series"This book rocked my world. That tidy little bod you've created in your head for how things should be is about to get blown away."-Steena Holmes, New York Times bestselling author of The Sister Under the Stairs"A powerful, discerning tale."-Midwest Book Review"A must-have that'll haunt the reader long after the last page." -Press & Sun-Bulletin"Ingeniously crafted." -Kevin Lucia, Editor, Cemetery Dance Publications
author: Tosca Lee
